COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b6
STRING: Aimlessly, I peeked in lecture halls where classes had
finished and practice rooms with their doors open.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cc
STRING: I knew some of the faces of the passing students.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d8
STRING: That's when I felt my social ineptitude; knowing nothing
more about any of these people beyond perhaps
recognizing their faces.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ee
STRING: All I managed was to meet the gaze of one student,
nod slightly and pass on by.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x224
STRING: Despite making up my mind to stop searching for the
day, I still found myself walking in the rain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23a
STRING: Of course, I didn't like getting wet in the rain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x246
STRING: But...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x252
STRING: The chill of the droplets that wet my skin, the distorted
view when the rain got in my eyes... Somehow I
couldn't bring myself to fully hate the experience.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x290
STRING: I didn't feel like just leaving the school, and before I
knew it, I was in a place I didn't recognize.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a6
STRING: With the noise of the school far away, a tranquil
atmosphere enveloped the place.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2bc
STRING: Off the tree-lined path that connected the gate and the
school buildings, down a narrow path thickly covered
with trees, was the Old Wing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2da
STRING: The many musicians who graduated from the Piova
Communal School of Music increased the prestige of its
name over time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f0
STRING: The number of students increased accordingly, and as
facilities were expanded, the original building became
cramped and obsolete.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x306
STRING: So with the help of the government and many
aristocrats, the current First and Second Halls and the
Concert Hall were built.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x31c
STRING: The government assisted to help the country's rich
culture permeate into the rest of the world.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x328
STRING: The aristocrats must feel some pride in that culture as
well.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x340
STRING: Now there are many children of aristocrats among the
students.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x360
STRING: And the original school building wasn't demolished, but
left as a free space for the students to use.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x376
STRING: It was regularly cleaned, and the pianos were kept in
tune by practicing students, but in the end it was no
longer functioning as a school building.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x396
STRING: In fact, I was sure I hadn't been here since I'd come just
for fun with Asino shortly after entering the school.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3ac
STRING: I heard from Asino that the aristocratic students in
particular never came here.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3c2
STRING: I had no reason to come since then, and that's all I
knew about it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3d8
STRING: [Chris] “Wow...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3ee
STRING: I was a little curious about the building I hadn't seen in
so long, and looked around a little.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x404
STRING: Even though it could be used freely, students didn't
normally come to the Old Wing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x41a
STRING: It was probably just students writing lyrics or wanting
some quiet time who visited occasionally.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x456
STRING: Then I vaguely heard a singing voice amidst the sound
of the rain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x462
STRING: There was definitely a student in there singing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x46e
STRING: It was a trivial thing that I normally would have ignored,
but from the sudden interest that had just arisen in me,
and the fact that I was searching for a partner,

COMMANDS.LABEL: 46e
STRING: I decided to take a peek inside.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4b6
STRING: Other than the voice I could hear, the place was silent,
so it wasn't hard to find.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4cc
STRING: The voice, along with some light, were spilling from a
slightly open door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x520
STRING: She was singing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x52c
STRING: She threw herself into the song that filled the classroom,
unheard by anyone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x542
STRING: I wasn't an expert on vocals, but she certainly had a
captivating voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x558
STRING: [???] “No matter what tomorrow brings...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x56e
STRING: My interest was piqued as she sang without
accompaniment, relying only on her voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x584
STRING: My fingers naturally moved as if pressing keys, and I
imagined the sound of my Fortelle mixing with her
voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x59a
STRING: As she finished the song, almost all of the phrases were
in my head. I felt I could play it at any time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5b0
STRING: The song itself wasn't very complicated, but the simple
melody was beautiful, and made striking by her voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5c6
STRING: The song was probably made for vocals, so the Fortelle
parts could be subdued.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5ee
STRING: I thought of this as I drew closer to the door, and she
quickly turned around just as she was about to start
singing again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x62a
STRING: [???] “Who are you...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x640
STRING: [Chris] “Oh... I-I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x680
STRING: She must have been shocked at the sudden appearance
of a visitor. She tensed up and didn't move.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x696
STRING: [Chris] “Um, I didn't mean to intrude... The door was
open. I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6b6
STRING: Even after my light apology for peeking, she didn't make
any move to answer.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6cc
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6e2
STRING: I started to feel like I was spying on her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6f8
STRING: But considering that she was singing where anyone
could pass by, and that the door was open from the
beginning, I wasn't doing anything that bad.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x718
STRING: [Chris] “Is something wrong...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x72e
STRING: She looked slightly afraid.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x73a
STRING: And she was still gazing at me reproachfully.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x750
STRING: I started to feel like I really did something wrong.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x75c
STRING: I backed out of the door to leave, and she grabbed her
bag and slipped between me and the door as if she
was waiting for the opportunity.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x784
STRING: [???] “E-Excuse me!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7be
STRING: [Chris] “Whoa!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x80a
STRING: She was running with her head down, so she ran into
me as I tried to get away.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x820
STRING: Text books and sheet music spilled from her open bag,
and she fell on her bottom next to them.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x856
STRING: [Chris] “Are... Are you okay?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x88a
STRING: I didn't think I was in the wrong, but I couldn't say I was
completely without fault.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8a0
STRING: I spoke to her, concerned but all the while feeling
slightly indignant.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8ac
STRING: [Chris] “Um, can I help you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8c2
STRING: But she just looked up at me and didn't speak.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8ce
STRING: And in her eyes, tears started welling up.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8da
STRING: [Chris] “I just heard your voice and came to see...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8fa
STRING: I spoke gently to her, picked up the scattered sheet
music, and held it out to her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x910
STRING: [Chris] “I'll get out of your way now. Here you are.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x93c
STRING: She just stared at the sheet music, but didn't take it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x952
STRING: [Chris] “Umm... Your sheet music.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x968
STRING: I placed the music at her feet, thinking to just leave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x974
STRING: But I felt like that would be too cold-hearted.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x996
STRING: [Chris] “Umm... Okay, I'll leave it here.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9ac
STRING: I wanted to ask about her singing, but she was avoiding
me so much, the conversation wouldn't have gotten
very far.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9c2
STRING: Which meant that it would be best for me to leave
without doing anything else.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9f6
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa14
STRING: [???] “Thank... Thank you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa2a
STRING: She finally took the music I was holding out in her small,
white hand.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa40
STRING: That hand was shaking slightly.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa4c
STRING: [Chris] “Don't worry about it. It was my fault for barging
in like that.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaa0
STRING: Was she really just surprised?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaac
STRING: Somehow it seemed like it was more than that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xab8
STRING: But I didn't think I could press her about it, so not being
there anymore would probably be best for her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xad8
STRING: [Chris] “Your singing was very good. That's my opinion
after listening without asking anyway.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb0e
STRING: [Chris] “Okay, I'll be going.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb32
STRING: As she stood up and brushed the dust off her clothes, I
bowed slightly to her, and put my hand on the door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb74
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb8a
STRING: I turned around in the direction of her voice behind me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbaa
STRING: She still had her eyes averted from my face, and faltered
as she tried to say something.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbc0
STRING: The awkwardness was not going to dissipate by itself,
so I urged her on with a gentle voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbd6
STRING: [Chris] “Is something wrong?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbf4
STRING: [???] “Umm... I'm sorry you had to hear that weird
song...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc0a
STRING: She said this with averted eyes, like she was making an
excuse.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc20
STRING: [Chris] “Weird...? I don't think it was weird at all. I
wasn't just being polite before. I meant what I said.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc72
STRING: She bowed her head and apologized again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc7e
STRING: Even though there was no reason for her to apologize.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc8a
STRING: [Chris] “What do you mean you're sorry?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcb6
STRING: Then she went silent again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcc2
STRING: Just what was I supposed to do here?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcce
STRING: Since she was talking to me, she must not have wanted
me to leave right away.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xce4
STRING: There wasn't really any need to talk further.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcfa
STRING: But I was a little concerned by the way she was acting.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd06
STRING: She didn't look like her at all, but her attitude reminded
me of a young Arietta.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd1c
STRING: At that time, Arie was down on herself for being the
only one without musical talent. She assumed
everything was her fault and was always apologizing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd32
STRING: Of course that was a long time ago, and now Arie had
found something to be proud of and no longer felt like
that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd48
STRING: Regardless, her attitude made it so that I couldn't just
leave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd5e
STRING: I knew from the color of her ribbon that she was a
first-year student, so I softened my tone slightly and
spoke to her again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd74
STRING: [Chris] “Why are you practicing in a place like this?
What about the practice rooms on the main campus?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd9c
STRING: [???] “Umm... I don't like crowds...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdb2
STRING: [Chris] “I see. In that case this place is nice and quiet.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdd2
STRING: It was still clumsy, but she actually answered me
normally, so I felt better.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe06
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe24
STRING: [???] “Sorry... Nothing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe3a
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe50
STRING: An awkward silence pervaded the space between us.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe5c
STRING: It seemed to be a habit for her to apologize.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe68
STRING: [Chris] “You don't have to apologize so much.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe9a
STRING: [???] “Um... Why are you here?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeb0
STRING: [Chris] “Oh, no reason. I was just passing by and heard
someone singing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf02
STRING: [Chris] “I didn't come here to practice or anything, in
case you were wondering.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf2a
STRING: [???] “Alright...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf40
STRING: I said it as a little joke, but it didn't register.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf4c
STRING: I started to wonder if she was even listening to me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf62
STRING: [Chris] “You should keep the door closed from now on.
You never know when someone like me could be
enticed by your voice to come in.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf9a
STRING: I tried to leave after giving her some advice, but then I
heard her voice behind me again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfc6
STRING: [???] “Yes, I'll be careful. I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfdc
STRING: [Chris] “You don't have to apologize.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x100e
STRING: [???] “Alright...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1024
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x103a
STRING: I almost got angry for a second, but suppressed it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1046
STRING: I saw her as Arie, just apologizing and not listening to
the kind words of her music teachers.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x105c
STRING: The more I thought of that, the more difficult it became
to leave..

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1072
STRING: She might have thought that I was nothing more than
some busybody.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1088
STRING: But if my words could change something...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1094
STRING: Arietta was able to change, after all.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10a0
STRING: I just needed to change the subject.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10ac
STRING: At the very least, I no longer wanted to leave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10b8
STRING: As long as she didn't make a more obviously unhappy
face.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10c4
STRING: [Chris] “So anyway... Are you a voice student?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10da
STRING: I tried to move on to a safer topic.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10e6
STRING: It was just a social greeting for any students meeting for
the first time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1124
STRING: For some reason, she looked surprised.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1130
STRING: She must have been surprised by the sudden change of
subject.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x113c
STRING: [Chris] “I mean, you were singing so beautifully. Am I
wrong?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x116e
STRING: [???] “Oh... No... I'm a first-year.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x118c
STRING: [???] “In... In voice.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11a2
STRING: [Chris] “I see. If you're a first-year, was that song for
homework?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11de
STRING: [???] “No... It wasn't.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11f4
STRING: [Chris] “Is it a famous song?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1228
STRING: [Chris] “It's a good song, though. I'm sure whoever
wrote it loves singing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x127a
STRING: [Chris] “You must like that song. It sounds like you've
sung it many times.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x129a
STRING: Also, I couldn't see the sheet music for it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12a6
STRING: It wasn't a very hard song to memorize, but I praised
her anyway.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12bc
STRING: Anyone would be happy hearing praise for a song they
liked.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12c8
STRING: Of course, that was kind of my plan.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12d4
STRING: But I did genuinely feel it was a beautiful song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1312
STRING: What looked like a smile finally appeared on the face of
the girl whose name I didn't know.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1328
STRING: [Chris] “Umm... I'm Chris Vertin. I'm a third-year Fortelle
student. Would you like to play together sometime?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1352
STRING: Relieved at her expression, I was able to ask her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x135e
STRING: It seemed pretty promising after all, but...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x139c
STRING: She froze with a shocked expression, and didn't say
anything for a while.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13b2
STRING: Did I... Did I say something wrong?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13be
STRING: [Chris] “Oh... It's okay if you can't. I was just thinking out
loud.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13de
STRING: I said that to try and fix things, and she apologized with
a thoughtful face.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1410
STRING: [???] “I'm sorry...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x142a
STRING: Um, I'm going home.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1444
STRING: [Chris] “Oh!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x145a
STRING: She held her now-closed bag under her arm, and tried
to pass by me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1470
STRING: Not wanting things to end on that note, I called out to
her from behind.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1486
STRING: [Chris] “Will... Will you come back here?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x149c
STRING: She turned around and stopped.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14da
STRING: [Chris] “Oh... Sorry to bother you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1522
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x156a
STRING: [Chris] “What?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x159c
STRING: [???] “Umm... My name.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15dc
STRING: She said only that, then left.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15e8
STRING: It seemed as if she felt obligated to tell me her name,
since I had introduced myself.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15fe
STRING: She didn't look very angry, and she said she wasn't
coming back, but I thought it might be a good idea to
come here one more time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x161e
STRING: There was no guarantee I'd see her, and I may not have
been welcome.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x162a
STRING: But I felt like I'd see her if I came back.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1656
STRING: I peeked out the window to see the rain had gotten
lighter.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1662
STRING: It was probably time to go home.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x167e
STRING: I wandered home, remembering her voice and that
song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16f2
STRING: [Phorni] “Welcome home. You're late again today, huh?
Were you practicing?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1712
STRING: [Chris] “Sort of...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1728
STRING: I wiped my head with the towel in the entryway and put
my bag down.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1734
STRING: I ended up not even touching my Fortelle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1740
STRING: But I did hear a good song, so it wasn't a complete
waste of a day.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1772
STRING: [Phorni] “Hey, did something happen today?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1788
STRING: [Chris] “Something a little different happened.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17ba
STRING: [Phorni] “Something different?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17e8
STRING: What was it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x183c
STRING: Fluttering her wings from her normal seat on the
window sill, Phorni waited for me to speak.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1852
STRING: I threw the towel in the laundry basket, wondering
where to start.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x185e
STRING: If I told her everything, she'd know that I hadn't played
my Fortelle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1874
STRING: I was looking for a partner, then met someone in the
old music rooms...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1880
STRING: And I heard that beautiful song. I started with that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18b2
STRING: [Phorni] “Wow... That's rare.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18c8
STRING: [Chris] “I guess. Singing there is a little strange.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18fa
STRING: [Phorni] “Not that. I mean the fact that you talked to her
first.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1910
STRING: [Chris] “I guess so...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x192e
STRING: [Phorni] “Usually you'd just ignore that kind of thing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1944
STRING: [Chris] “I'm not that cold.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1976
STRING: [Phorni] “You like her...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x198c
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19a2
STRING: I corrected Phorni's words a little.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19ae
STRING: [Chris] “No, I was intrigued.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19e0
STRING: [Phorni] “By what?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19f6
STRING: [Chris] “The song... Her voice.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a0c
STRING: I only heard it once, but that song was still in my head.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a22
STRING: That, and her voice ringing out in the silence.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a2e
STRING: [Chris] “And because she was kind of like Arie.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a44
STRING: I added that, to make it into a joke.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a50
STRING: But Phorni was a little better, and turned it back on me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a82
STRING: [Phorni] “You really like the quiet ones, don't you?.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a98
STRING: Phorni could use words like a blunt weapon sometimes..

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1aa4
STRING: She was a little like Arie, but even I didn't honestly know
whether or not that was my preference.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1aba
STRING: [Chris] “That's beside the point...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1aec
STRING: [Phorni] “Hmm. So are you planning on making that girl
your partner?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b02
STRING: [Chris] “No, that wasn't my plan. We haven't even
played together.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b3e
STRING: [Phorni] “Are you planning to play together?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b54
STRING: [Chris] “I was thinking that might be good.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b86
STRING: [Phorni] “I think Torta would be best.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b9c
STRING: [Chris] “It's too early to decide. Nothing good comes
from rushing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bc4
STRING: [Phorni] “That's true... But you're not rushing enough,
Chris.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bda
STRING: [Chris] “There's still time, so I'm looking slowly.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c16
STRING: [Phorni] “Slowly...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c44
STRING: You just need to do it, before you become an old man.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c5a
STRING: [Chris] “Yeah-yeah. I'll figure it out in time.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c9e
STRING: Telling Phorni what happened during the day like this
was already a daily routine.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cb4
STRING: She didn't want to go outside, but always wanted to
hear me talk about it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ccc
STRING: Fairies are mysterious creatures; even after living with
one for almost three years, I didn't fully understand
them.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ce2
STRING: She could touch things, but didn't get wet in the rain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cee
STRING: She didn't eat anything, and could sing and sing without
getting tired.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d04
STRING: She floated, but couldn't fly, and she could appear and
disappear at will.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d1a
STRING: Despite defying the laws of physics, she couldn't get up
high and was always bugging me for a hand.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d32
STRING: But... Leaving a towel by the door after I left in the
morning became Phorni's job at some point.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d48
STRING: In short, it was impossible to think about Phorni
logically. If you could accept her for what she was, it
was quite fun.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d68
STRING: In ancient times written about in history books, people
lost a part of their civilization called “magic.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d7e
STRING: It was replaced at some point by a field called “science,”
which made a fair amount of progress over many long
years.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d94
STRING: But there were still many things not understood in the
world.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1daa
STRING: One of those things was a cheerful fairy, skilled at
singing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1dc2
STRING: Thinking about the unknown boundaries of the world
was a boundless and ultimately futile exercise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1dce
STRING: That's what I had come to think these days.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1df6
STRING: And so my usual interaction with Phorni finished, and
another day came to a close.
